task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block, approach and align the circular end-effector to its push face, establish gentle contact, push it toward the goal direction, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A table-top pushing task with a UR-style arm and a circular (blue) tool. The robot must push a T-shaped block across a smooth white surface toward a fixed goal region. The plan emphasizes reliable perception followed by careful approach, tool yaw alignment, and controlled contact prior to the main push. The tree includes a fallback to scan when the object is not immediately visible, tight alignment tolerance for stable contact, and a timed push followed by a short retreat and hold.
stepwise_plan: Perceive the T-shaped block; scan if not visible
Move above the object and align precisely
Set tool yaw and lower until contact
Execute a timed push along the goal direction
success_criteria: Block translates along intended direction by planned distance
No loss of contact during push
Robot ends safely clear of the object
failure_and_recovery: If perception fails: scan raster and retry
If contact not detected: re-approach and lower again
If push deviates: retreat, realign, and repeat sequence
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when push completes, object motion settles, and the tool retreats.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool is aligned at the block’s side with initial contact geometry visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation is expected in subsequent frames, confirming direction of motion.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-shaped block is visible.
Performs a raster scan to localize the block.
Moves above the object at a safe vertical offset.
Lateral approach and fine alignment to the push face.
Orient the tool yaw to align with the push direction.
Lower gently until contact is detected.
Push the block along the goal direction for a set distance.
Back off from the object to a safe distance.
Brief wait to stabilize after motion.

recovery_strategy: Re-approach and re-align at tight tolerance
Re-establish contact then attempt push again
assumptions: Frames show a red T-shaped block; instruction mentions gray. We follow frames.
Green goal region is not clearly visible; we assume a known goal direction and use direction_deg=180.
Tool yaw may be non-critical for a circular tool; kept at 0° for consistency.

expected_success_criteria: Block moves in intended direction by ~0.2 m with continuous contact
Robot retreats safely with no collision
